Package com.project.dao

Interface NewDietPlanDao

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NewDietPlanDaoImpl
    public interface NewDietPlanDao
    This interface defines the methods that need to be implemented for carrying out basic operations for diet plans(DietPlan). Contains 4 methods to view, modify, delete and insert a diet plan(DietPlan) into the database.
    Author:
    Harsh Sharma

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int deleteDietPlan​(int dietNum)
      Interface Method to delete a particular DietPlan from the database.
      int insertDietDetails​(DietPlan diet)
      Interface Method to insert a diet plan in the database.
      java.util.ArrayList<DietPlan> readDietDetails​(java.lang.String userName)
      Interface Method to read or retrieve all the DietPlans for a particular user.
      int updateDietDetails​(DietPlan diet)
      Interface Method to update a particular DietPlan.

    • Method Detail

      • insertDietDetails

        int insertDietDetails​(DietPlan diet)
               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        Interface Method to insert a diet plan in the database. Takes a DietPlan object as a parameter and returns an integer if the insertion was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        diet - A object of DietPlan class.
        Returns:
        int The result after insertion i.e., 1 or 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when the requested class is not found in the class path.
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws when an error occurs due to any wrong implementation of a SQL query or any database calls.

      • readDietDetails

        java.util.ArrayList<DietPlan> readDietDetails​(java.lang.String userName)
                                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                              java.sql.SQLException
        Interface Method to read or retrieve all the DietPlans for a particular user. All the diet plans corresponding to a particular user name are fetched from the database and inserted in a list that is returned.
        Parameters:
        userName - Holds the name of the user whose DietPlan are to be fetched.
        Returns:
        ArrayList A List of DietPlans.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when the requested class is not found in the class path.
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws when an error occurs due to any wrong implementation of a SQL query or any database calls.

      • updateDietDetails

        int updateDietDetails​(DietPlan diet)
               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        Interface Method to update a particular DietPlan. It modifies the existing DietPlan with new details/values. Takes in a DietPlan object as a parameter and returns a corresponding integer for success or failure of operation.
        Parameters:
        diet - A object of DietPlan class.
        Returns:
        int The result after updating the DietPlan i.e., 1 or 0 for success or failure respectively.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when the requested class is not found in the class path.
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws when an error occurs due to any wrong implementation of a SQL query or any database calls.

      • deleteDietPlan

        int deleteDietPlan​(int dietNum)
            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                   java.sql.SQLException
        Interface Method to delete a particular DietPlan from the database. The DietPlan corresponding to particular diet number is deleted. Thus this method takes in an integer that is the diet plan number and on success or failure of deletion returns a respective integer number.
        Parameters:
        dietNum - Holds the diet plan number.
        Returns:
        int The result after deleting the DietPlan i.e., 1 or 0 for success or failure respectively.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when the requested class is not found in the class path.
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws when an error occurs due to any wrong implementation of a SQL query or any database calls.
